Class QuadTreePath

  • java.lang.Object
    • QuadTreePath
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class QuadTreePath
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class representing the path to an Entity in a QuadTree. Note that when talking about cardinal directions, we're talking about with respect to the Cartesian plane, unlike on a Graphics object, where the y axis is reversed.

    0 = North-east
    1 = North-west
    2 = South-west
    3 = South-east

    Some examples of valid QuadTree paths:
    {-2} -> QuadTree outlier
    {-1} -> root QuadBranch
    {-1, 0} -> North-east quadrant of root QuadBranch
    {-1, 0, 3, 2, 2} -> Go NE, SE, SW, SW from root

    Author:
    Jiayin Huang, Sally Hui, Tony Cui
    See Also:
    QuadTree, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuadTreePath

        public QuadTreePath(boolean isBranch)
        If isBranch is true, this QuadTreePath points towards the root QuadBranch. If isBranch is false, this QuadTreePath points towards the outliers list in the QuadTree.
        Parameters:
        isBranch - if this path should point to the root QuadBranch or not

      • QuadTreePath

        private QuadTreePath(int[] nodes)
        Creates a new QuadTreePath with the specified nodes.
        Parameters:
        nodes - the specified quadrant ID sequence

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public int get(int index)
        Retrieves the quadrant ID node at the specified index in the QuadTreePath.
        Parameters:
        index - the index in the QuadTreePath
        Returns:
        the ID number for the node at the specified index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • getPath

        public int[] getPath()
        Returns an int array containing the full list of quadrant ID nodes in this QuadTreePath in the correct order.
        Returns:
        an int array containing all of the nodes in this QuadTreePath.

      • getBranchPath

        public QuadTreePath getBranchPath(int quadrant)
        Returns a new QuadTreePath instance identical to this one, but with the specified quadrant ID node concatenated to the end.
        Parameters:
        quadrant - the quadrant ID to append to the path
        Returns:
        a new QuadTreePath with the added quadrant ID node

      • getParentPath

        public QuadTreePath getParentPath()
        Returns a new QuadTreePath instance identical to this one, except one node shorter. The last quadrant ID node is truncated. Returns null if this QuadTreePath is already length 0.
        Returns:
        a new QuadTreePath that's one node shorter

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this QuadTreePath as a list of QuadBranch quadrants, separated by commas. For example: QuadTreePath@1dc5237{-1,3,0,0,3,0,3,3}
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
